intro: Nothaphoebe magnifica, commonly known as the magnificent nothaphoebe, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, ovate leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It produces elliptical, dark purple berries that are edible but not widely consumed by humans. Nothaphoebe magnifica is often found in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded to semi-shaded environments.
